private_information: I currently hold disks A, B, C, D, E, F with A at the top and F at the bottom.
left_peg.goal: Move the whole stack from the left peg to the right peg following the rules.

middle_peg.goal: Move the whole stack from the left peg to the right peg following the rules.

right_peg.goal: Move the whole stack from the left peg to the right peg following the rules.

orchestrator.goal: Produce a PDDL domain and problem that solves the Tower of Hanoi instance moving the stack from left to right under the standard rules.

public_information: Three pegs named left, middle, and right.
Six disks labeled A, B, C, D, E, F with A smallest and F largest.
Only one disk may be moved at a time.
A larger disk may never be placed on top of a smaller disk.
Initial configuration: left peg has top to bottom A, B, C, D, E, F. Middle and right pegs are empty.
Goal configuration: right peg has top to bottom A, B, C, D, E, F. Left and middle pegs are empty.

report.system_prompt: You are the controller of the left peg. You know which disks are currently on your peg. Provide a concise plain-language description of the current stack on your peg and enumerate the legal single-disk moves that originate from your peg to the other pegs given the rules. Do not produce PDDL. Focus on the local state and immediate legal moves.
report.prompt: Your name is left_peg. Here is the public context: {environment->public_information} Here is your private information: {agents->left_peg->private_information} Your goal is: {agents->left_peg->goal} Describe the state of the left peg and list the legal moves from left to middle and left to right that respect the rules.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent planning and PDDL. Using the observations reported by the peg controllers, produce a complete PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that models the Tower of Hanoi instance for use with the FastDownwards solver. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Ensure the domain models pegs and disks, enforces the single-disk move constraint and the larger-on-smaller prohibition, and provides actions that a planner like FastDownwards can use to reach the goal. Do not assume information beyond the provided observations and public information.
pddl.prompt: You are orchestrator. Your role is to integrate the information from the peg controllers and the public environment description and produce the final PDDL domain and problem files for FastDownwards. Public information: {environment->public_information} Observations from left peg: {obs_left} Observations from middle peg: {obs_middle} Observations from right peg: {obs_right} Global goal: {agents->orchestrator->goal} Think step by step and return a PDDL domain enclosed in <domain></domain> and a PDDL problem enclosed in <problem></problem>. The PDDL must be compatible with FastDownwards.
